title: Replace dark neon theme with sunset aesthetic across all pages

requirements.summary: Replace dark neon gaming theme in index.css with full sunset aesthetic using NYC sunset palette
acceptanceCriteria: All CSS custom property values for background, card, border, and accent colors reflect the sunset palette (deep purples, navy-blacks, golden yellows, burnt oranges, dusky pinks).
Neon glow utility classes produce warm orange/pink/golden shadows, not cyan or green.
Google Fonts (Orbitron, Rajdhani) are still imported.
The 'Game Vault' red → purple → orange gradient CSS is unchanged.

file_operations.description: Replace all neon-themed CSS custom properties (cyan, electric-orange, hot-pink backgrounds and accents) with sunset palette tokens: deep dusk purple/navy-black backgrounds (#1a0a2e, #0d0519, #1c0f3f), warm dark mid-tones (#2d1b4e, #3a1a2a), and sunset accents (golden yellow #f5a623, burnt orange #e85d04, dusky pink #d63384, soft purple #9b59b6). Update glow utility classes (.neon-glow, .neon-border, text-shadow utilities) to emit warm sunset glows using orange/pink/golden box-shadows and text-shadows instead of cyan/green neon effects. Preserve the existing Orbitron and Rajdhani Google Font imports. Do NOT modify the --game-vault-gradient CSS variable or any inline gradient producing the red → purple → orange 'Game Vault' text.

requirements.summary: Update Tailwind config to replace neon color tokens with sunset palette tokens
acceptanceCriteria: Tailwind config exports sunset palette color tokens.
No references to neon-cyan, electric-orange, or hot-pink color tokens remain in the config.
pulse-glow and any glow keyframes use warm sunset shadow colors.

file_operations.description: Replace all neon-themed color tokens (neon-cyan, electric-orange, hot-pink, etc.) in the theme.extend.colors section with sunset palette tokens: sunset-gold (#f5a623), sunset-orange (#e85d04), sunset-pink (#d63384), sunset-purple (#9b59b6), dusk-bg (#0d0519), dusk-mid (#1a0a2e). Update the pulse-glow keyframe animation and any other custom animation colors to use warm sunset tones (orange/pink/golden shadows). Ensure CSS variable-based color references still resolve correctly against the updated index.css tokens.

requirements.summary: Apply sunset theme consistently across all frontend page and layout components
acceptanceCriteria: Storefront, product detail, checkout, order confirmation, and admin panel pages all display deep dusk purple/navy-black backgrounds.
All interactive elements (buttons, links, badges, form focus rings) use sunset accent colors (golden yellow, burnt orange, dusky pink, soft purple).
No neon-cyan, electric-green, or hot-pink accents appear anywhere in the UI.
Card backgrounds and borders use dark warm sunset tones.
The 'Game Vault' text gradient (red → purple → orange) is visually unchanged in navbar, footer, and loading screen.

Update background colors to deep dusk purple/navy-black tones, card borders and accents to warm sunset colors, and hover states to use golden/orange/pink highlights. Preserve any existing 'Game Vault' gradient text.

requirements.summary: Update LoadingScreen3D component with sunset palette colors in both HTML overlay and Three.js scene
acceptanceCriteria: The Three.js sky/background uses a warm sunset gradient (orange-gold at horizon, deep purple at top).
Building materials use dark silhouette tones with warm lit windows.
Vehicle and light colors are warm orange/yellow rather than cyan/neon.
HTML overlay elements in the loading screen use sunset palette backgrounds and text colors.
The 'Game Vault' gradient text in the loading screen overlay is unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the Three.js scene to use warm sunset colors: change the sky gradient to warm golden-orange at the horizon (#ff7043 → #ff8c00) transitioning to deep purple at the top (#4a0e8f), update building materials to dark silhouette tones with warm orange/yellow lit windows, change vehicle colors and street lighting to warm orange/yellow tones instead of cyan/neon. Also update the HTML overlay UI elements (title text container background, progress bar colors, any text styling) to use sunset palette colors (deep dusk backgrounds, golden/orange/pink accents). Preserve the 'Game Vault' gradient text in the loading screen overlay exactly as-is (red → purple → orange).
